title: Impeachment and Disqualification of Lokman Singh Karki
description:
This case concerns the controversial tenure, impeachment, and eventual disqualification of Lokman Singh Karki as the Chief Commissioner of the Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA), Nepal's primary anti-corruption body. Appointed on May 8, 2013, by the Constitutional Council chaired by Khil Raj Regmi, his appointment was contentious from the outset due to his past record.

During his tenure, Karki was widely accused of grossly abusing his authority. Allegations included running a 'parallel government' by intimidating politicians and bureaucrats, illegally interfering in the medical education sector to benefit relatives associated with KIST Medical College, and using the CIAA to settle personal scores. He was also accused of showing contempt for parliamentary committees and the judiciary.

The case culminated in two parallel actions:

  1. Impeachment Motion: On October 19, 2016, 157 lawmakers from the CPN-UML and CPN (Maoist Centre) registered an impeachment motion against him in the Legislature-Parliament, citing nine major charges, including overstepping jurisdiction and running the CIAA in an autocratic manner. This led to his immediate suspension.
  2. Supreme Court Verdict: Concurrently, the Supreme Court reviewed a petition challenging the legality of his appointment. On January 8, 2017, a full bench of the Supreme Court annulled Karki's appointment. The court ruled he was ineligible for the post from the beginning, stating he lacked the requisite 'high moral character' (citing the Rayamajhi Commission's findings against him for suppressing the 2006 People's Movement) and did not meet the 20-year service experience criterion stipulated by the constitution.

Following the Supreme Court's verdict which effectively removed him from office, the impeachment motion in parliament was rendered redundant and did not proceed to a vote.
unverified_info:
This section contains allegations and claims that were reported in the media or other secondary sources but were not officially substantiated by court verdicts or official investigation reports.

  • There were media reports suggesting that India's external intelligence agency, R&AW (Research and Analysis Wing), had influenced Nepali political leaders to secure Karki's appointment to the powerful post of CIAA Chief.
  • In a book published after the events, Durga Subedi, the husband of former Chief Justice Sushila Karki, claimed that Lokman Singh Karki had attempted to offer a bribe of Rs 100 million to the then-Chief Justice to secure a favorable verdict in his appointment case.
  • It was widely alleged in news reports that Karki was using state resources to conduct surveillance and spy on political leaders, security chiefs, and his critics, potentially for the purpose of blackmail.
  • Rumors circulated that Karki was selectively pursuing corruption cases, targeting minor offenders while protecting influential individuals or 'big fish' in exchange for illicit benefits.
key_allegations: Abuse of power and running a 'parallel government'
Unconstitutional appointment due to lack of moral character and insufficient service tenure
Interference in the medical education sector for personal gain
Vindictiveness and favoritism in corruption investigations
alleged_entities: Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA)

timeline.title: Suppression of People's Movement
timeline.description: As Chief Secretary, Lokman Singh Karki played a key role in suppressing the 2006 People's Movement (Jana Andolan II). The subsequent Rayamajhi Commission found him guilty and recommended his disqualification from holding public office.

timeline.title: Appointment as CIAA Chief
timeline.description: Karki is appointed Chief Commissioner of the CIAA by President Ram Baran Yadav upon the recommendation of the Constitutional Council, chaired by Khil Raj Regmi.

timeline.title: Supreme Court Quashes Initial Petition
timeline.description: The Supreme Court, in an initial ruling, quashes a writ petition filed by Advocate Om Prakash Aryal that challenged the constitutionality of Karki's appointment.

timeline.title: Supreme Court Agrees to Review Appointment
timeline.description: A full bench of the Supreme Court, led by Chief Justice Sushila Karki, grants permission to review its previous verdict on Karki's appointment, citing new questions about his eligibility.

timeline.title: Impeachment Motion Filed and Suspension
timeline.description: 157 lawmakers from CPN-UML and CPN (Maoist Centre) file an impeachment motion against Karki, leading to his automatic suspension as CIAA Chief.

timeline.title: Impeachment Deliberations Begin
timeline.description: The Legislature-Parliament begins deliberations on the impeachment motion against Lokman Singh Karki.

timeline.title: Supreme Court Anuls Appointment
timeline.description: The Supreme Court's full bench annuls Karki's appointment, ruling him ineligible for the post due to a lack of required moral character and service tenure.

timeline.title: Karki Leaves Nepal
timeline.description: Disqualified and removed from his post, Lokman Singh Karki leaves Nepal for New Delhi.

timeline.title: Parliamentary Probe Concludes
timeline.description: A parliamentary sub-committee investigating the impeachment charges concludes that most allegations were valid but deems the motion unnecessary as Karki was already removed by the court.
